å“æœ‰æˆæ•ˆçš„ç®¡ç†è€…æ€»æ˜¯æŠŠé‡è¦çš„äº‹æƒ…æ”¾åœ¨å‰é¢å…ˆåšï¼ˆfirst things firstï¼‰ï¼Œè€Œä¸”ä¸€æ¬¡åªåšå¥½ä¸€ä»¶äº‹ï¼ˆdo one thing at a timeï¼‰ã€‚
For manual workï¼Œwe need only efficiencyï¼›that isï¼Œthe ability to do things right rather than the ability to get the right things done.
Knowledge work is not defined by quantity.Neither is knowledge work defined by its costs.Knowledge work is defined by its results.

The knowledge worker cannot be supervised closely or in detail.He can only be helped.But he must direct himselfï¼Œand he must direct himself toward performance and contributionï¼Œthat isï¼Œtoward effectiveness.
The greatest wisdom not applied to action and behavior is meaningless data.
For every organization needs performance in three major areas:It needs direct resultsï¼›building of values and their reaffirmationï¼›and building and developing people for tomorrow.
4.Effective executives concentrate on the few major areas where superior performance will produce outstanding results.
If there is any oneâ€œsecretâ€of effectivenessï¼Œit is concentration.Effective executives do first things first and they do one thing at a time.
The truly important events on the outside are not the trends.They are changes in the trends.
2.Executives are forced to keep onâ€œoperatingâ€unless they take positive action to change the reality in which they live and work.

I have calledâ€œexecutivesâ€those knowledge workersï¼Œmanagersï¼Œor individual professionals who are expected by virtue of their position or their knowledge to make decisions in the normal course of their work that have significant impact on the performance and results of the whole.
